title: Digital Inclusive Language Learning Design: VR/Simulation-Based Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Basic proficiency in digital device usage and elementary language comprehension
context.additional_context: An environment requiring optimized accessibility via smartphones and consideration of varying learner experience levels

learning_goals: Learners can independently perform language communication tasks with over 80% proficiency using digital tools in VR simulation environments.
Learners can document (in a portfolio) the process of collaborating with peers who have diverse digital experiences to solve language learning problems
Learners can apply digital accessibility principles (e.g., captioning, speech rate adjustment) to improve language learning content

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
